Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2008 04:23AM Mel-4 wrote: I had a bilateral mastectomy on March 12, 08.  My incisions are diagonal on both sides.  The incisions really never have bothered me besides the way they look at first.  But when they start to heal they start blending in and don't really look bad at all.  The drains were the most uncomfortable because of how you have to hold on to them every time you move.  My husband started taking the double sided medical tape, amost like a sticky ace bandage and wrapping it around my waist then we would put the bulbs from the lines in like a pouch on the front.  That made moving around so much easier. I had expanders put in at the time of surgery so when I woke up I had a really tight feeling in my chest due to the muscle being pulled.  You will get use to that and each fill up.  When they put the saline in the expanders it doesn't hurt at all.  Then for about two or three day you'll feel the muscles pull and stretch but they should give you pain meds for any discomfort.  Putting the implants in was a breeze.  It feels so much better to wake up with out those expanders. If I can help you in any other way please feel free to ask.  You know I had breast cancer in my left breast but decided to have both taking off because of family history.  I have people ask if I had to do it all over again if I would do it the same and the answer is always yes.  I don't regret doing it the way I did.  I pray everything will go smoothly for you. Melinda
